Subject: mutate_toggle_enable_prob, mutate_gene_reenable_prob
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=216215274
X-Yahoo-Profile: gerbopel

Hello everyone,

Experienced programmer but very new to NEAT and to neuroevolution in 
general.

So I'm working on a project that involves evolving a group of cat agents 
that learn to successfully hunt an AI mouse in a pac-man style maze (line of 
sight only).  Everything is going well so far.

However, I am curious to know everyone's thoughts about the two mutation 
properties listed in the subject header.  I notice that Ken has them set at 
0.1 and 0.05 for the DPNV experiment and 0.0 for the rest.  I am using Mat 
Buckland's WinNEAT and have added these two mutators to the code but am 
unsure at how much to put their probabilities at.  10% seems like a lot for 
disabling genes and then only 1/20 of the time will we re-enable one.

So I have two questions:

1) Why so high for DPNV in particular?
2) What situations would you say that they are beneficial, when would they 
not be too helpful?

My networks have 16 inputs and 5 outputs, they will end up being partially 
recurrent.

Many thanks
Mike
